meanings.definition: In a cunning or sly manner.
meanings.sent1: She moved foxily through the crowd, trying to avoid being seen.
meanings.sent2: He smiled foxily as he plotted his next prank.
meanings.sent3: The cat watched the mouse foxily, waiting for the perfect moment to pounce.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes gleamed foxily as she outsmarted her opponent in the game.
meanings.sent5: The detective followed the suspect foxily, staying hidden from view.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a fox.
meanings.sent1: The foxily colored leaves rustled in the wind.
meanings.sent2: She had a foxily cunning look in her eyes.
meanings.sent3: The foxily clever child always found a way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: His foxily sharp senses alerted him to danger nearby.
meanings.sent5: The foxily graceful movements of the dancer captivated the audience.
